about_the_game:
"The Last Visit: 98th" is a psychological indie horror from the first person, in the genre of a walking simulator, in the setting of the post-Soviet winter space. The main focus is on the atmosphere of horror, which is highlighted by realistic 3D graphics and immersive 3D sounds.

In 1998, the main character returns to his native area, where he spent his childhood. A year after his parents' death, he finally decided to visit the empty apartment. He needs to prepare it for sale, but he is facing some difficulties. His car breaks down and he has to spend the night in an apartment where every corner reminds of the pain of loss. Plunged into the dark streets and creepy corridors of his past, he begins to be consumed by dark secrets that he will have to deal with.

◇ Visit one of the courtyards of the post-Soviet space of the late 90s, immerse yourself in the winter atmosphere and try to find the key to salvation among the snowdrifts.

◇ Wander through Soviet apartments, solving mysteries and collecting evidence
◇ In addition to fear, you will feel calm and peaceful.

◇ Solve puzzles to get to the truth.

◇ But don't forget that there is always someone nearby...
